I don't know what everyone sees in this place.   It is located just off the main tourist strip in what appears to be a nice plaza.  There is a lot of outdoor seating (which is always a plus).The centerpiece of the plaza is a children's playground surrounded by buildings in which some have bricked up windows.   Service was brisk both times I was here.   Prices were very tourist like.  They have a lot of talapas on the menu and the ones we ordered were okay. Outside of that the main entrées are burgers.   My beer, when it came to the table was well below the .5l marker on the glass. Why serve a customer a glass with a marker when you're not even going to come close?    That pretty much sums up my experience.
